body_content.explanation:
abbreviation for 
community first responder : a trained volunteer (= a person who does something willingly and without being paid) who helps the ambulance service (= the special vehicles and people that go to deal with medical emergencies) by going quickly to an emergency and giving medical help:
examples: As a community first responder (CFR), you'll provide emergency treatment to people in your local area.
Our CFRs are volunteers who are trained by us to attend certain types of emergency calls in the area where they live or work.
